questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to either the Development Interfaces or Operations and maintenance interfaces sections?

discussion.content:
https://vceguide.com/which-2-statements-apply-to-either-the-development-interfaces-or-operations-and-maintenance-interfaces-sections/

According to this, answers D and F

choices.A: Delete entry 2 because this interface will be contained in the Communication Management Strategy.
choices.B: Delete entry 3 because this interface will be contained in the project control section of the Project Initiation Documentation.
choices.D: Add 'Project Board, with responsibility for communicating progress to corporate management' to
choices.F: Add 'Facilities Team Manager, with responsibility for the transfer of services provided by the Facilities Division' to Development Interfaces.
choices.C: Amend entry 4 to 'The transferred products relating to the services provided by the Facilities Division'.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to either the Techniques, processes and procedures or Constraints sections?

discussion.content: I think it should be A & D
Entry seven describes a cost tolerance.

choices.D: Delete entry 6 because this applies to Office Moves Limited and is therefore outside the Work Package.
choices.E: Delete entry 7 because this should be contained in the Quality skills required section of the Product Description.
choices.B: Add 'There must be minimum disruption to current services' to Constraints.
choices.A: Delete entry 1 because this section should contain the techniques, processes and procedures required for specialist product development.
choices.C: Move entry 5 to Techniques, processes and procedures because this is a technique which staff should be aware of.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to either the Reporting arrangements or Problem handling and escalation sections?

choices.A: Replace entry 8 with 'Checkpoint Report every Monday by 10.00 am' because Highlight Reports are intended for the Project Board.
choices.E: Delete entry 11 because the impact analysis should be provided when the issue is notified.
choices.D: Add 'Any risks identified to be added to the Risk Register' to Reporting arrangements.
choices.C: Move entry 10 to Problem handling and escalation because that section describes how issues are handled.
choices.B: Delete entry 9 because this level of detail is unnecessary.

discussion.content:
the correct statements are:

C. Move entry 10 to Problem handling and escalation because that section describes how issues are handled.
D. Add ‘Any risks identified to be added to the Risk Register’ to Reporting arrangements.

comments.content:
the recording of risks is typically included in the Reporting arrangements section1. This is because it’s important for the Project Manager to be aware of any risks that have been identified during the course of work, and this information is usually included in regular reports.

On the other hand, the Problem handling and escalation section is more about how issues will be escalated to the Project Manager1. This typically involves operational problems or issues that need immediate attention, rather than potential risks that might affect the project in the future.

discussion.content:
A Correct:The PRINCE2 progress report from the Team Manager to the Project Manager is the Checkpoint Report and not the Highlight Report. 
B Incorrect:Reporting arrangements should contain details of the contents required, including products worked on. 
Correct:Anything to do with issues should come under the Problem handling and escalation section. Ref. A.26.2
D Incorrect:The recording of risks should be added to the Problem handling and escalation section, not the Reporting arrangements section. Ref. A.26.2.
E Incorrect: Issues should be notified immediately. The impact analysis will take place afterwards.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to either the Extracts or references or Approval method sections?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BF
Answers should be B & F
A – Incorrect - Stage Plan is correct. It is reasonable to point to where the Stage Plan can be obtained. This may assist the Team Manager to produce the Team Plan. Ref. A.26.2.
B – Correct - It is important to point to where Product Descriptions can be obtained if they are not provided in the Work Package. Ref. A.26.2.
F – Correct – Answer should read ‘A suitable entry for Approval method would be 'The Project Manager is to be advised of completion of the Work Package by email'’ - Reasoning is The Project Manager has to be advised as to when Work Packages have been completed. Advice from the Team Manager by email is an acceptable method. Ref. A.26.2
Is F not a Approval Method?

choices.E: Delete entry 13 because this is NOT a Project Assurance responsibility.
choices.B: A suitable entry for Extracts or references would be 'Product Descriptions are available from Project Support'.
choices.C: Move entry 13 to Reporting arrangements because this describes how completion will be advised to the
choices.A: Delete entry 12 because this should be the Team Plan not the Stage Plan.
choices.F: Add 'The Project Manager is to be advised of completion of the Work Package by email'.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
At the end of stage 3, the service provider will be selected and the contract awarded. During stage 4, the Account Manager for the selected service provider will work with the Project Manager to complete the transition of the services to the selected service provider.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: False ( selected service provider is in stage 4) , True |True, True | False, True | True, False | False, True | False, True
Should 4B not be false, as the Reporting Arrangements is to do with Checkpoint reports between the Team and PM? Page 541

1 - False, True
2 - True, True
3 - False, False
4 - False, True
5 - False (Benefit Tolerances are project-level tolerarance set at a Business Case Table 12.1), True
